title: The year when truth died: The internet blackout that changed an Indian state
Videos show moment of massive Beirut blast
description: A large explosion ripped through the Lebanese capital Beirut, injuring people and smashing windows in buildings across the city.

title: New York mayor responds to health commissioner's resignation
description: New York City Mayor Bill de Blasio responds to the resignation of Oxiris Barbot, the city's health commissioner, who helped lead efforts to contain Covid-19.

title: Fulham triumph in world's most lucrative football match, worth a possible $346 million
description: Joe Bryan's two extra-time goals secured Fulham a 2-1 victory against Brentford and a place in the English Premier League in what's been dubbed the world's most valuable football match in Tuesday's Championship play-off final.

title: Keilar pushes back on Trump campaign claims of voter fraud
description: CNN's Brianna Keilar fact checks Trump campaign senior adviser Mercedes Schlapp's position that mail in voting can lead to election fraud.

title: Remember when Dolly Parton fully subverted the 'dumb blonde' cliché with her 80s excess styling?
description: At the Los Angeles premiere of "Steel Magnolias" on November 9, 1989, country diva Dolly Parton was a walking embodiment of that decade of excess: skyscraper hair, elongated nails, pneumatic boobs, and a dress smothered in rhinestones. "I kinda patterned my look after Cinderella and Mother Goose -- and the local hooker," she once said, always ready to beat her critics to a punchline.

title: Surfers have unexpected greeting with a pair of whales
description: Beachgoers in Australia got a closeup view of two southern right whales just off Manly Beach in Sydney.

title: Watch some of TikTok's biggest moments
description: While TikTok's future remains uncertain, there's no denying the cultural impact the app has already made. Here's a look back at some of the platform's biggest trends from Lil Nas X's "Old Town Road" to the pandemic-themed "Bored in the House."

title: Opening schools could be the hardest battle in the war on Covid
description: The price the world has already paid for the Covid-19 pandemic is eyewatering: massive loss of life, long-term health concerns for survivors, job losses and a widespread economic meltdown sparked by large-scale lockdowns.

title: Hear from parents torn over sending kids back to school
description: CNN's Miguel Marquez talks to four parents from the same school district in Arizona about sending their children back to school during the coronavirus pandemic.

title: Audi pulls 'insensitive' ad featuring girl eating banana in front of car
description: Audi has apologized for an advert showing a young girl eating a banana in front of a premium car, admitting it was "insensitive" and promising not to use the image in future.

title: Watch President Trump's interview on Axios
description: President Trump sat down with Axios reporter Jonathan Swan to discuss a wide variety of topics including the coronavirus pandemic.

title: Amazon was selling shoes using the N-word until a UK lawmaker complained
'SOS' in the sand saves Pacific island mariners
description: An "SOS" message written on the beach of a tiny Pacific island pointed rescuers to three missing mariners, United States and Australian authorities said Tuesday.

title: Police say man shot at a store's employee after dispute over masks
description: A Pennsylvania man is facing charges of attempted criminal homicide after he allegedly shot at an employee of a cigar shop who asked him to wear a mask.

title: 'So shameful': CNN political director reacts to Trump's comments on John Lewis
description: CNN political director David Chalian responds to President Donald Trump's comments on late congressman and civil rights icon John Lewis, calling them "shameful."

title: Couple dies in same week of coronavirus leaving behind teen son
description: 17-year-old Justin Hunter tells CNN's Chris Cuomo about losing both of his parents, Angie and Eugene Hunter, to coronavirus in the same week.

title: Trump criticizes Birx for the first time after she issues coronavirus warnings
'Out of control': Distancing and masks no longer enough in US
description: Once again, Covid-19 deaths are rising after weeks of record-breaking new cases and hospitalizations.

title: Leaked police bodycam video shows new details of George Floyd's fatal arrest
description: In partial footage obtained by the Daily Mail from the body cameras worn by two of the now-former Minneapolis police officers involved in the arrest of George Floyd, a panicked Floyd can be seen struggling with officers while in the back of a squad car in the minutes before his death, saying, "I can't breathe."

title: What Hong Kong's iconic trams and ferries could look like in a post-Covid world
description: Hong Kong's public transit system has long been regarded as one of the most efficient in the world, so it's no surprise that a ride on the famed tram, MTR or Star Ferry is a must on every traveler's bucket list.

title: Twitter could face a $250 million FTC fine for using phone numbers to target ads
description: Twitter disclosed in a regulatory filing that it could face a fine of up to $250 million from US authorities over its use of phone numbers and email addresses to target advertisements.
